comments.author: BADecker
comments.body: Do you remember that old James Bond 007 movie, "Goldfinger," from the mid 1960s? Goldfinger was a bad guy who owned a bunch of gold. His idea was to set off a dirty nuke at Fort Knox, the US repository for its gold, so that the gold would become so radioactive that nobody could access it for 200 years. This would make the value of his gold soar.Storing the gold would have to follow these points:1. Well enough away from where it could be nuked by the US, Russia, Canada or China.2. But not hidden, so that everybody would know where their gold was being stored.3. And accessible so that anybody could take ownership of his gold at almost any time by shipping it to him.4. And what about if the country where the gold was stored decided to make gold ownership illegal, and confiscated it all?And that would only be starters. The price of security would eat away the value of the gold.Personally, I would be uncomfortable handling this kind of valuable property belonging to other people.
